item.title: Michelle add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "Like most misery, it started with apparent happiness." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Canadians are fond of a good disaster, especially if it has ice, water, or snow in it. You thought the national flag was about a leaf, didn't you? Look harder. It's where someone got axed in the snow." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Michelle add a quote by charles dickens
item.description: "To conceal anything from those to whom I am attached, is not in my nature. I can never close my lips where I have opened my heart." -- charles dickens

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Nancy E. Turner
item.description: "A nice girl should never go anywhere without a loaded gun and a big knife." ~ Sarah Agnes Prine" -- Nancy E. Turner

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
item.description: "Joy is the infallible sign of the presence of God." -- Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Laura Schlessinger
item.description: "The TEN Commandments are not prefaced with "If you're in the mood"." -- Laura Schlessinger

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "People who claim that they're evil are usually no worse than the rest of us... It's people who claim that they're good, or any way better than the rest of us, that you have to be wary of." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "<i>Gone mad</i> is what they say, and sometimes <i>Run mad</i>, as if mad is a different direction, like west; as if mad is a different house you could step into, or a separate country entirely. But when you go mad you don't go any other place, you stay where you are. And somebody else comes in." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Some people are born to make great art and others are born to appreciate it. â€¦ It is a kind of talent in itself, to be an audience, whether you are the spectator in the gallery or you are listening to the voice of the world's greatest soprano. Not everyone can be the artist. There have to be those who witness the art, who love and appreciate what they have been privileged to see." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Dr. Laura Schlessinger
item.description: "You are what you do - first do good, then feel good." -- Dr. Laura Schlessinger

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Frank Lloyd Wright
item.description: "Television is chewing gum for the eyes." -- Frank Lloyd Wright

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Gerrold
item.description: "I'm all in favor of keeping dangerous weapons out of the hands of fools. Let's start with typewriters." -- David Gerrold

item.title: Michelle add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description:
"I have only made this letter longer because I have not had the time to make it shorter."
(<i>Letter 16</i>, 1657)" -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "God doesnâ€™t need to punish us. He just grants us a long enough life to punish ourselves." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "When we traded homemaking for careers, we were implicitly promised economic independence and worldly influence. But a devil of a bargain it has turned out to be in terms of daily life. We gave up the aroma of warm bread rising, the measured pace of nurturing routines, the creative task of molding our families' tastes and zest for life; we received in exchange the minivan and the Lunchable." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "April is the cruelest month, T.S. Eliot wrote, by which I think he meant (among other things) that springtime makes people crazy. We expect too much, the world burgeons with promises it can't keep, all passion is really a setup, and we're doomed to get our hearts broken yet again. I agree, and would further add: Who cares? Every spring I go out there anyway, around the bend, unconditionally. ... Come the end of the dark days, I am more than joyful. I'm nuts. " -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Michelle add a quote by James L. Ferrell
item.description: "Being Mistreated is the most important condition of mortality, for eternity itself depends on how we view those who mistreat us." -- James L. Ferrell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Elizabeth Lesser
item.description: "Adversity is a natural part of being human. It is the height of arrogance to prescribe a moral code or health regime or spiritual practice as an amulet to keep things from falling apart. Things do fall apart. It is in their nature to do so. When we try to protect ourselves from the inevitability of change, we are not listening to the soul. We are listening to our fear of life and death, our lack of faith, our smaller ego's will to prevail. To listen to your soul is to stop fighting with life--to stop fighting when things fall apart; when they don't go our away, when we get sick, when we are betrayed or mistreated or misunderstood. To listen to the soul is to slow down, to feel deeply, to see ourselves clearly, to surrender to discomfort and uncertainty and to wait." -- Elizabeth Lesser

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Arbinger Institute
item.description: "The more sure I am that I'm right, the more likely I will actually be mistaken. My need to be right makes it more likely that I will be wrong! Likewise, the more sure I am that I am mistreated, the more likely I am to miss ways that I am mistreating others myself. My need for justification obscures the truth." -- Arbinger Institute

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "Happy endings are still endings." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "Where I'm from, we believe in all sorts of things that aren't true... we call it history." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "In the lives of children, pumpkins turn into coaches, mice and rats turn into men. When we grow up, we realize it is far more common for men to turn into rats." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "Not everyone is born a witch or a saint. Not everyone is born talented, or crooked, or blessed; some are born definite in no particular at all. We are a fountain of shimmering contradictions, most of us. Beautiful in the concept, if we're lucky, but frequently tedious or regrettable as we flesh ourselves out." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "He lingered at the door, and said, 'The Lion wants courage, the Tin Man a heart, and the Scarecrow brains. Dorothy wants to go home. What do you want?'... She couldn't say <i> forgiveness, </i> not to Liir. She started to say 'a soldier,' to make fun of his mooning affections over the guys in uniform. But realizing even as she said it that he would be hurt, she caught herself halfway, and in the end what came out of her mouth surprised them both. She said, 'A soul-' He blinked at her." -- Gregory Maguire
